- Path to scale: productise modules (off‚Äëthe‚Äëshelf playbooks), build digital self‚Äëserve course for 70% of content, create Train‚Äëthe‚ÄëTrainer (TtT) programme to scale reach, license curriculum to HR partners.
- Automation opportunities: onboarding bots, automated skills assessments, analytics dashboards for ROI tracking, templated prompts and role‚Äëspecific libraries to reduce prep from hours to minutes.

ROI Framework (customer perspective ‚Äî training 30 people)
Assumptions vary by scenario: per‚Äëperson hourly value and hours saved.

1) Conservative
- 10 hrs saved/month; ¬£35/hr => ¬£350/month/person ‚Üí 30 people = ¬£10,500/month (¬£126k/year)
- Payback on Sprint (¬£17.5k): 1.7 months

2) Base
- 20 hrs saved/month; ¬£45/hr => ¬£900/month/person ‚Üí 30 people = ¬£27,000/month (¬£324k/year)
- Payback: 0.65 months

3) Aggressive
- 30 hrs saved/month; ¬£60/hr => ¬£1,800/month/person ‚Üí 30 people = ¬£54,000/month (¬£648k/year)
- Payback: 0.32 months

Value metrics to track: hours saved per role, % of team weekly AI use, time‚Äëto‚Äëfirst‚Äëimpact, cost per hour saved.

Revenue Expansion & CLTV
- Upsell opportunities: 1) Managed prompt engineering & tool integrations (¬£3k‚Äì¬£10k/month), 2) Custom LLM fine‚Äëtuning / governance projects (¬£30k+), 3) Subscription access to prompts + analytics (¬£50‚Äì200/user/year), 4) TtT licensing to internal L&D.
- Recurring potential: convert 30‚Äì40% of Sprint clients to support subscription (¬£6‚Äì12k/year avg).
- CLTV example: initial Sprint ¬£17.5k + avg recurring ¬£12k/year over 2 years = ¬£41.5k. Subtract CAC (~¬£6k) ‚Üí net CLTV ‚âà ¬£35.5k.
Actionable insights
- Promote Sprint as primary land-and-expand product; use Exec Briefings as low‚Äëcost lead generator.
- Rapidly productise 40% of content into digital modules to increase capacity 3x and improve margins.
- Package a 12‚Äëmonth subscription (support + analytics + 2 refresher workshops) to turn one‚Äëoffs into predictable ARR.

pricingStrategy.fullContent:
# AI-B-C‚Ñ¢ ‚Ä¢ Pricing Roi

Business Model Canvas (condensed)
- Key Partners: LMS & LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic), HR/L&D buyers, channel partners (regional consultancies), enterprise sales agencies.
- Key Activities: executive briefings, team workshops, 90‚Äëday sprints, content creation, customer success & measurement.
- Key Resources: senior AI consultants, facilitators, modular curriculum, analytics dashboard, B‚ÄëCorp brand.
- Cost Structure: direct delivery costs (consultants, travel, licences), content amortisation, sales & marketing, platform & overhead.
- Revenue Streams: one‚Äëoff training fees (Exec ¬£2k, Workshop ¬£8.8k, Sprint ¬£17.5k), recurring support/subscription, premium custom projects, licensing.

Unit Economics (assumptions shown)
Assumptions: senior consultant fully‚Äëloaded ¬£120/hr; junior facilitator ¬£60/hr; travel/materials/platform amortised per engagement.

1) Exec Briefing (90 mins) ‚Äî Price ¬£2,000
- Direct cost: prep (4h senior) ¬£480 + delivery (1.5h senior) ¬£180 + admin ¬£50 + travel/materials ¬£240 = ¬£950
- Gross margin: ¬£1,050 (53%)

2) Team Workshop Day ‚Äî Price ¬£8,800
- Direct cost: prep (8h senior + 8h junior) ¬£1,440 + delivery (8h senior+8h junior) ¬£1,440 + travel ¬£300 + materials/platform ¬£350 = ¬£3,530
- Gross margin: ¬£5,270 (60%)

3) Complete Sprint ‚Äî Price ¬£17,500
- Direct cost: exec + 2 workshops + 30‚Äëday support + content amortisation ‚âà ¬£11,110
- Gross margin: ¬£6,390 (37%)

Breakeven (monthly)
- Fixed costs (allocated to product): 2 FTEs (¬£16k), marketing ¬£4k, platform ¬£1k = ¬£21k/month.
- Using a representative monthly mix (1 Sprint, 2 Workshops, 2 Execs): contribution ‚âà ¬£19k on revenue ¬£39.1k ‚Äî short of fixed costs.
- Target monthly revenue to break even ‚âà ¬£43‚Äì45k (roughly one Sprint + 2 Workshops + 3 Execs). Action: aim for ¬£540k ARR to cover current headcount and growth.

Pricing Strategy
- Model & justification: value‚Äëbased tiering ‚Äî low‚Äëfriction Exec (¬£2k) to openthe door; Workshops (¬£8.8k) for team transformation; Sprint (¬£17.5k) as value bundle. Prices align to delivered ROI (see ROI section) and boutique premium positioning.
- Competitive positioning: premium boutique vs large consultancies ‚Äî charge 25‚Äì40% below top consultancies but above mass e‚Äëlearning; emphasise bespoke facilitation, measurable productivity gains, B‚ÄëCorp values.
- Price testing framework: run cohort A/B tests on discount (10% vs 0%) to measure conversion lift; pilot ‚Äúvalue‚Äëshare‚Äù offer (reduced upfront, bonus on realised savings) for 5 clients; track CAC payback, NPS, time‚Äëto‚Äëvalue. Use landing page price experiments and win/loss interviews.

Scalability Analysis
- Constraints: senior facilitator capacity, customisation time, travel, sales cycle.
- Path to scale: productise modules (off‚Äëthe‚Äëshelf playbooks), build digital self‚Äëserve course for 70% of content, create Train‚Äëthe‚ÄëTrainer (TtT) programme to scale reach, license curriculum to HR partners.
- Automation opportunities: onboarding bots, automated skills assessments, analytics dashboards for ROI tracking, templated prompts and role‚Äëspecific libraries to reduce prep from hours to minutes.

ROI Framework (customer perspective ‚Äî training 30 people)
Assumptions vary by scenario: per‚Äëperson hourly value and hours saved.

1) Conservative
- 10 hrs saved/month; ¬£35/hr => ¬£350/month/person ‚Üí 30 people = ¬£10,500/month (¬£126k/year)
- Payback on Sprint (¬£17.5k): 1.7 months

2) Base
- 20 hrs saved/month; ¬£45/hr => ¬£900/month/person ‚Üí 30 people = ¬£27,000/month (¬£324k/year)
- Payback: 0.65 months

3) Aggressive
- 30 hrs saved/month; ¬£60/hr => ¬£1,800/month/person ‚Üí 30 people = ¬£54,000/month (¬£648k/year)
- Payback: 0.32 months

Value metrics to track: hours saved per role, % of team weekly AI use, time‚Äëto‚Äëfirst‚Äëimpact, cost per hour saved.

Revenue Expansion & CLTV
- Upsell opportunities: 1) Managed prompt engineering & tool integrations (¬£3k‚Äì¬£10k/month), 2) Custom LLM fine‚Äëtuning / governance projects (¬£30k+), 3) Subscription access to prompts + analytics (¬£50‚Äì200/user/year), 4) TtT licensing to internal L&D.
- Recurring potential: convert 30‚Äì40% of Sprint clients to support subscription (¬£6‚Äì12k/year avg).
- CLTV example: initial Sprint ¬£17.5k + avg recurring ¬£12k/year over 2 years = ¬£41.5k. Subtract CAC (~¬£6k) ‚Üí net CLTV ‚âà ¬£35.5k.
Actionable insights
- Promote Sprint as primary land-and-expand product; use Exec Briefings as low‚Äëcost lead generator.
- Rapidly productise 40% of content into digital modules to increase capacity 3x and improve margins.
- Package a 12‚Äëmonth subscription (support + analytics + 2 refresher workshops) to turn one‚Äëoffs into predictable ARR.

sections.AI-B-C‚Ñ¢ ‚Ä¢ Gtm Strategy:
Implementation Playbook ‚Äî AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC‚Ñ¢ (Brilliant Noise)

Purpose: Practical, time‚Äëbound playbook to take AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC‚Ñ¢ from boutique product offering to a scalable, repeatable revenue engine while protecting quality, B‚ÄëCorp values and Brilliant Noise‚Äôs market positioning.

Assumptions (use to sanity‚Äëcheck capacity targets; revise with real headcount/bench data)
- Current core AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC delivery team: ~6 people (1 Programme Lead, 2 Senior Facilitators, 1 Learning Designer, 1 AI Engineer, 1 Customer Success/PM). Adjust if different.
- Current baseline monthly delivery capacity (conservative boutique pace):
  - Complete Sprint: 2 / month (24 / year) @ ¬£17,500 = ¬£420k
  - Team Workshop Days: 4 / month (48 / year) @ ¬£8,800 = ¬£422k
  - Executive Briefings: 8 / month (96 / year) @ ¬£2,000 = ¬£192k
  - Baseline annual revenue (AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC products) ‚âà ¬£1.03M
- Target: 10x revenue ‚âà ¬£10M+ ARR from AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC portfolio within 36 months.
- Enterprise sales cycle: 8‚Äì14 weeks average. Conversion benchmarks to model (adjust to real data): briefing ‚Üí workshop conversion 30%, qualified lead ‚Üí Complete Sprint 10‚Äì20%.

SECTION 1 ‚Äî Channel Strategy (Primary and Secondary)
Goal: Maximise high‚Äëvalue enterprise deals, build consistent lead flow and partner distribution for scale.

Primary channels (focus, highest ROI for enterprise targets)
1. Direct Enterprise Sales (ABM & outbound)
   - Rationale: Buyers are CMOs/CDOs/Innovation leaders; need relationship selling and consultative demos.
   - Activities: Targeted outbound, executive briefings as pricing entry point, tailored ABM content.
2. Strategic Partnerships (co‚Äëselling with HR/L&D vendors, systems integrators, boutique consultancies)
   - Rationale: Faster access to larger client pools, scalability via partner delivery (train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer/resell).
3. Content & Thought Leadership (LinkedIn, long‚Äëform case studies, executive webinars/roundtables)
   - Rationale: Builds credibility, leads for briefings and workshops, aligns with C‚Äësuite consumption habits.

Secondary channels (support scale, lower CAC)
4. Channel Aggregators / Learning Marketplaces (LMS marketplaces, corporate training platforms)
   - Rationale: Volume licensing, seat sales, passive revenue once content packaged.
5. Event Partnerships & Conferences (sponsor CMO/innovation events)
   - Rationale: Brand awareness, pipeline acceleration.
6. Referral Network (agencies, alumni, client champions)
   - Rationale: Lower CAC, high trust conversion.

Action items (30/60/90)
- 0‚Äì30d: Build ABM ICP lists (top 150 targets) + outreach templates.
- 30‚Äì90d: Engage 5 prospective partners; draft partner commercial terms (referral %, co‚Äësell splits).
- 90‚Äì180d: List target marketplaces (LMS), scope packaging requirements.

SECTION 2 ‚Äî Scalability Roadmap (grow from baseline to 10x revenue)
Structure: 3 phases over 36 months with measurable milestones.

Phase 0 ‚Äî Stabilise & Systematise (0‚Äì6 months) ‚Äî Target ARR: ¬£1‚Äì1.5M
- Goals: Harden delivery playbooks, improve conversion rates, increase average deal size.
- Milestones:
  - Standardised Sprint & workshop playbook completed and certified.
  - Sales playbook + value calculator live.
  - Pipeline of 20 qualified enterprise accounts.
- Revenue levers:
  - Improve briefing‚Üísprint conversion from 30% ‚Üí 45%.
  - Introduce a 3‚Äëmonth success package add‚Äëon at ¬£6‚Äì10k.

Phase 1 ‚Äî Scale Delivery & Demand (6‚Äì18 months) ‚Äî Target ARR: ¬£3‚Äì4M
- Goals: Grow headcount, launch productised digital offers, sign 3 strategic partners.
- Milestones:
  - Launch digital self‚Äëstudy course + certification (price per seat ¬£300‚Äì¬£800).
  - Train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer program launched; 5 partner trainers certified.
  - Increase monthly Complete Sprints to 6 / month.
- Revenue mix: 40% high‚Äëtouch sprints & workshops, 30% digital/licensing, 30% partner revenue.

Phase 2 ‚Äî Repeatable Scale & Leverage (18‚Äì36 months) ‚Äî Target ARR: ¬£6‚Äì12M
- Goals: Licensing model and platformisation, partner network at scale, automation reduces marginal delivery cost.
- Milestones:
  - Licensed offering to 15 partners; 4 market vertical specialists.
  - Rolling subscription product (LMS+playbooks) with 2000 seats sold/under license.
  - Monthly Complete Sprints 12+/month (mix of Brilliant Noise & partner delivery).
- Revenue mix: 30% direct consultancy, 50% product/licensing & digital, 20% partner income.

Specific actions & owners
- Sales Director: drive ABM and enterprise pipeline (owner).
- Head of Partnerships: recruit & enable partners (owner).
- Head of Product & Delivery: productise workshops, build LMS content.
- Quarterly KPI reviews: ARR, pipeline, conversion, CAC, gross margin.

SECTION 3 ‚Äî Operational Model (delivery process, quality control, resources)
Delivery process (end‚Äëto‚Äëend for Complete Sprint)
1. Discovery & Executive Briefing (pre‚Äësale prep)
   - Duration: 1‚Äì2 weeks
   - Deliverables: stakeholder map, current state AI adoption audit, success metrics.
2. Sprint planning & pre‚Äëwork
   - Duration: 2 weeks
   - Deliverables: customised curriculum, role‚Äëspecific pre‚Äëwork, data/access checklist.
3. Team Workshop 1 (capability & hands‚Äëon)
   - Duration: 1 day
   - Deliverables: role paths, initial playbooks, templates.
4. Team Workshop 2 (apply to real work)
   - Duration: 1 day (often a week later)
   - Deliverables: prototypes, automation recipes, saved time metrics.
5. Embed & Measure (30‚Äì90 days)
   - Duration: 30‚Äì90 days of success management
   - Deliverables: adoption dashboard, ROI tracking, internal champion enablement.

Resource requirements per Complete Sprint (typical)
- Programme Lead: 10 days
- 2 Senior Facilitators: 8 days each (prep + delivery)
- Learning Designer: 6 days (curriculum + materials)
- AI Engineer/Practitioner: 6 days (tools/templates, coaching)
- Customer Success / PM: 6 days
Total resource consumption ‚âà 44 consultant‚Äëdays (billable/effort) per sprint.

Capacity constraints (realistic)
- 1 FTE senior facilitator = ~12 billable days/month.
- With current team of 6, total ‚âà 72 billable days/month ‚Üí ~1‚Äì2 sprints + workshops as baseline.
- Growth trigger: when utilisation >80% and pipeline indicates +2 sprints/month, hire 1 Senior Facilitator + 0.5 AI Engineer.

Quality control & governance
- Standardised playbooks & templates (single source of truth in Notion or Confluence).
- Facilitator certification program (internal: bronze/silver/gold tiers).
- Pre‚Äëdelivery checklists & client sign‚Äëoff gates.
- Post‚Äëengagement NPS + outcome metrics (adoption %, hours saved per person).
- Quarterly peer review of deliverables and client feedback loop.

Action items (first 90 days)
- Codify delivery playbook + checklists; create 1‚Äëpage engagement KPI dashboard template.
- Build facilitator certification syllabus (owner: Head of Delivery).
- Set up delivery capacity spreadsheet and hire plan triggers.

SECTION 4 ‚Äî Partnership Framework (referral, co‚Äësell, strategic)
Partnership types & commercial models
1. Referral partners (agencies, consultants)
   - Fee: 10‚Äì20% of first year revenue or fixed referral fee (¬£2k‚Äì¬£5k per Complete Sprint referral).
   - Low admin, quick to scale.
2. Co‚Äësell partners (HR/L&D vendors, digital agencies)
   - Fee: 25‚Äì40% margin split on jointly delivered projects; Brilliant Noise handles methodology and QA.
   - Joint GTM events & shared pipeline ownership.
3. Reseller / White‚Äëlabel (large training providers)
   - Fee: wholesale pricing (40‚Äì60% discount) with support & certification requirements.
   - Good for geography scale & seat sales.
4. Technology & platform partners (OpenAI, LMS vendors, analytics)
   - Joint marketing, product integrations, credibility boost.
   - Non‚Äëfinancial (co‚Äëmarketing) + preferred supplier status.

Partner enablement
- Partner kit: pitch deck, 2 case studies, pricing matrix, co‚Äëdelivery playbook.
- 1‚Äëday partner certification bootcamp, quarterly enablement webinars.
- PRM (partner relationship management) portal + lead registration process.

Referral program mechanics (quick launch)
- Offer 15% commission on first‚Äëyear revenue for 12 months.
- Fast pay: pay within 30 days of client payment.
- Track via signed referral form & CRM tagging.
- Quarterly leaderboard + incentives.

Strategic partnerships (target list & outreach)
- HR/L&D integrators (global players with corporate client lists).
- Specialist agencies in CPG/retail (aligns with client list).
- Tech partners for enterprise AI governance & security.

Action items (0‚Äì90d)
- Build partner kit + one‚Äëpager commissions table.
- Hire/assign Head of Partnerships; sign 3 pilot partners in 6 months.
- Install PRM & define SLAs / quality gates for partner‚Äëdelivered engagements.

SECTION 5 ‚Äî Marketing Engine (channel priorities, content strategy, lead generation)
Priority channels & allocation
- Owned content & thought leadership (35% effort/cost) ‚Äî LinkedIn, long‚Äëform case studies, POVs.
- ABM & outbound (30%) ‚Äî targeted campaigns, executive briefings pipeline.
- Partner co‚Äëmarketing (15%) ‚Äî webinars, joint case studies.
- Paid LinkedIn / search for executive briefings (10%) ‚Äî tightly targeted.
- Events & PR (10%) ‚Äî speaking slots at CMO forums, B‚ÄëCorp community.

Content strategy (themes & assets)
- Executive assets (short, high‚Äëimpact):
  - Executive Briefing pack (90‚Äëminute) ‚Äî downloadable.
  - ROI calculator: show 20 hrs/month per person ‚Üí cost savings model.
  - 3 vertical case studies (adidas, BMW style) with before/after metrics.
- Mid‚Äëfunnel assets:
  - Workshop outcomes playbook (role‚Äëspecific recipes).
  - Short demo video of team outcomes & testimonials.
- Bottom‚Äëfunnel assets:
  - Implementation checklist, SLAs, pilot offer page.
- Evergreen: Blog series on "AI for Marketing Teams" ‚Äî 1 long piece/month.

Lead‚Äëgen plays (repeatable)
1. Executive Briefing funnel (signature)
   - Ads + LinkedIn outreach ‚Üí booking page ‚Üí paid briefing (¬£2k) ‚Üí upsell to workshop/sprint.
   - Conversion focus: briefing ‚Üí Sprint uplift via tailored ROI case.
2. Webinars & roundtables (monthly)
   - Invite top 40 ICP prospects per session; convert 15% to briefing.
3. ABM cadences
   - Multi‚Äëtouch: LinkedIn + email + phone + content + event invite.
   - Personalised email + ROI one‚Äëpager ‚Üí offer 90‚Äëmin paid briefing.
4. Partner co‚Äëhosted webinars ‚Äî pipeline share.

Metrics to track weekly/monthly
- SQLs, MQL‚ÜíSQL conversion, briefing bookings, briefing‚Üísprint conversion, CAC per channel, LTV, churn (for any subscription products).
- KPI targets (first 12 months): 30 booked briefings/month; 20% briefing‚ÜíComplete Sprint; pipeline to revenue conversion 10%.

Action items (30/60/120 days)
- Build landing pages for briefing, workshop, sprint with clear outcomes and booking flow.
- Launch ROI calculator and integrate into sales process.
- Produce 3 case studies and 6 LinkedIn thought posts for next 90 days.
- Run first ABM campaign to top 150 ICP accounts.

SECTION 6 ‚Äî Sales Process (qualification, conversion, onboarding)
Sales motion: Consultancy‚Äëled, outcomes‚Äëfocused.

Qualification framework (modified BANT)
- Budget: Is there training / transformation budget? (HR / L&D often a fund source)
- Authority: CMO / CDO / Head of Innovation engaged? Executive sponsor identified?
- Need: Adoption stalled? KPI tied to productivity or revenue?
- Timing: Are they looking to act in 30/60/90 days?
- Impact: Estimated people affected (# seats) √ó expected hours saved ‚Üí clear ¬£ impact.

Sales stages & activity
1. Engage (inbound briefing / outbound intro)
   - Asset: executive briefing offer.
   - KPI: booking rate.
2. Discover (scoped discovery call + pre‚Äëwork)
   - Deliverable: scope doc + success metrics.
3. Pilot / Sprint Proposal
   - Deliverable: proposal, timeline & outcomes, signed MSA.
4. Deliver (Sprint)
   - Internal alignment: delivery kickoff w/ client.
5. Expand (embed & upsell)
   - Success metrics review & cross‚Äësell packages (train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer, licensing).

Conversion levers
- Offer paid briefing at ¬£2k to pre‚Äëqualify seriousness and reduce time waste.
- Always include a success metric (e.g., expected hours saved & financial estimate).
- Time‚Äëlimited starter package discount to accelerate decision (e.g., 10% off Complete Sprint if signed within 30 days of briefing).

Onboarding checklist (first 30 days)
- Stakeholder kickoff & RACI.
- Access to platforms & sample tasks.
- Pre‚Äëwork assigned and baseline adoption metrics collected.
- Internal champion and measurement owner designated.

KPIs & targets
- Target briefing ‚Üí sprint conversion: 30‚Äì45% (ramp to 50% with refined ICP & messaging).
- Sales cycle time: target 8‚Äì10 weeks from initial conversation to signed sprint.
- Average deal size improvement levers: add subscription usage, success management retainer.

SECTION 7 ‚Äî Growth Levers (automation, productization, team expansion plan)
Automation opportunities (reduce marginal cost, increase throughput)
- Booking & payments: self‚Äëserve booking for executive briefings + automated upsell flow.
- Pre‚Äëwork & assessments: automated self‚Äëassessment tool that produces client readiness report.
- LMS + templated content: push standard role paths into an LMS to reduce facilitator prep time by 30‚Äì50%.
- AI assistant for scaled coaching: use prompt templates & a lightweight bot to support participants between workshops.
- Reporting automation: automatic adoption dashboards (data connectors to Slack, MS365, Google Workspace) to measure usage and hours saved.

Productization path (3 product tiers)
1. Productised Starter (Self‚Äëservice + light facilitation)
   - Digital course + templates + 2 live Q&A sessions. Price: ¬£500‚Äì¬£1,000 per seat.
   - Low touch, scalable revenue.
2. Core Offer (Current Complete Sprint)
   - High touch, bespoke. Price: ¬£17.5k+.
3. Enterprise Subscription (LMS + coaching + governance)
   - Annual contract: seat licences + quarterly strategy reviews + dedicated success manager.
   - Price: ¬£50‚Äì250k/year per large client (depending on seats & services).

Train‚Äëthe‚ÄëTrainer and Partner Certification
- Create a 3‚Äëday certification + enablement pack for partners / internal champions.
- Certification fuels reseller & white‚Äëlabel distribution.

Team expansion plan (hiring triggers & roles)
Baseline hires to reach Phase 1 (6‚Äì18 months)
- +2 Senior Facilitators (hire when pipeline indicates +2 sprints/month).
- +1 AI Engineer / Practitioner (for scaling toolkits and automation).
- +1 Customer Success Manager (for embed & subscriptions).
- +1 Head of Partnerships (if not already allocated).
- +1 Sales Director / Enterprise AE (to run ABM).

Phase 2 hires (18‚Äì36 months)
- +2 Learning Designers (digital course scale).
- +2 Partner Enablement / Ops.
- +1 Product Manager (for LMS & subscription).
- +1 Marketing Manager (demand gen)
- Consider regional leads for US/EU expansion.

Hiring triggers (quantitative)
- Hire Senior Facilitator when projected monthly Complete Sprints > current capacity + 2 for more than 2 months.
- Hire Customer Success when >6 active sprints in embed phase or first subscription customers signed.
- Hire Head of Partnerships if projected partner pipeline > 10 signed referrals / month.

Financial/Unit economics guardrails
- Target gross margin for high‚Äëtouch delivery: 50‚Äì60% (billable day rates vs salaries).
- Target gross margin for digital/licensed products: 70‚Äì90%.
- CAC payback target: <12 months for enterprise deals, <6 months for subscriptions.

SECTION 8 ‚Äî Growth Milestones, KPIs & Timeline (implementation calendar)
0‚Äì3 months
- Deliverables: delivery playbook, facilitator certification, partner kit, ABM list.
- Targets: 10 briefings booked/month, 2 new pilot partners contacted.
- Owners: Head of Delivery, Sales Director, Head of Partnerships.

3‚Äì9 months
- Deliverables: live digital course MVP, first 3 case studies, PRM deployed.
- Targets: Monthly briefings 20, Complete Sprints/month to 4‚Äì6, 3 partner certifications, revenue ¬£1.5‚Äì2.5M.
- Owners: Product & Delivery, Marketing.

9‚Äì18 months
- Deliverables: train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer launched, LMS packaged, first enterprise subscriptions signed.
- Targets: ARR ¬£3‚Äì4M, partner channel contributes 20% revenue, monthly sprints 6‚Äì8.
- Owners: Head of Partnerships, Sales Director.

18‚Äì36 months
- Deliverables: partner network 15+, licensed product revenue scale, automation stack largely in place.
- Targets: ARR ¬£6‚Äì12M, digital/licensing 40‚Äì60% revenue.
- Owners: CEO, Head of Product.

Specific 30/60/90 day action checklist (execution sprint)
- Day 0‚Äì30:
  - Finalise playbook + deliverable templates (Owner: Head of Delivery).
  - Build ABM target list & outreach sequences (Owner: Sales Director).
  - Create partner kit & outreach to 10 target partners (Owner: Head of Partnerships).
- Day 30‚Äì60:
  - Launch first ABM campaign; measure briefing bookings (Owner: Marketing & Sales).
  - Build digital course MVP (Owner: Learning Designer).
  - Run facilitator certification (Owner: Head of Delivery).
- Day 60‚Äì90:
  - Close first 3 paid briefings ‚Üí convert at least 1 to sprint.
  - Deploy referral program and pay first referral.
  - Implement automated reporting dashboard for client outcomes.

Risks & Mitigations
- Risk: quality dilution at scale ‚Üí Mitigation: strict certification, partner SLAs, internal QA.
- Risk: commoditisation by larger consultancies ‚Üí Mitigation: maintain boutique positioning, speed & practical ROI; leverage B‚ÄëCorp story.
- Risk: long enterprise sales cycles ‚Üí Mitigation: paid briefings to accelerate qualification & revenue; strong ABM pipeline.

Final notes ‚Äî what to measure weekly
- Sales: briefing bookings, pipeline value, Deals signed, average TtC (time to close).
- Delivery: utilisation %, active engagements, facilitator backlog.
- Marketing: MQLs, CAC by channel, briefing acquisition cost.
- Product: seats sold, certified partners, monthly recurring revenue (for subscriptions).

If helpful I can:
- Convert this playbook into a 90‚Äëday execution plan with owners and a Kanban view.
- Produce standard operating templates: playbook PDF, facilitator certification checklist, partner agreement draft, or the ROI calculator spreadsheet referenced above. Which would you like first?

  - Team Workshop Days: 4 / month (48 / year) @ ¬£8,800 = ¬£422k
  - Executive Briefings: 8 / month (96 / year) @ ¬£2,000 = ¬£192k
  - Baseline annual revenue (AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC products) ‚âà ¬£1.03M
- Target: 10x revenue ‚âà ¬£10M+ ARR from AI‚ÄëB‚ÄëC portfolio within 36 months.
- Enterprise sales cycle: 8‚Äì14 weeks average. Conversion benchmarks to model (adjust to real data): briefing ‚Üí workshop conversion 30%, qualified lead ‚Üí Complete Sprint 10‚Äì20%.

SECTION 1 ‚Äî Channel Strategy (Primary and Secondary)
Goal: Maximise high‚Äëvalue enterprise deals, build consistent lead flow and partner distribution for scale.

Primary channels (focus, highest ROI for enterprise targets)
1. Direct Enterprise Sales (ABM & outbound)
   - Rationale: Buyers are CMOs/CDOs/Innovation leaders; need relationship selling and consultative demos.
   - Activities: Targeted outbound, executive briefings as pricing entry point, tailored ABM content.
2. Strategic Partnerships (co‚Äëselling with HR/L&D vendors, systems integrators, boutique consultancies)
   - Rationale: Faster access to larger client pools, scalability via partner delivery (train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer/resell).
3. Content & Thought Leadership (LinkedIn, long‚Äëform case studies, executive webinars/roundtables)
   - Rationale: Builds credibility, leads for briefings and workshops, aligns with C‚Äësuite consumption habits.

Secondary channels (support scale, lower CAC)
4. Channel Aggregators / Learning Marketplaces (LMS marketplaces, corporate training platforms)
   - Rationale: Volume licensing, seat sales, passive revenue once content packaged.
5. Event Partnerships & Conferences (sponsor CMO/innovation events)
   - Rationale: Brand awareness, pipeline acceleration.
6. Referral Network (agencies, alumni, client champions)
   - Rationale: Lower CAC, high trust conversion.

Action items (30/60/90)
- 0‚Äì30d: Build ABM ICP lists (top 150 targets) + outreach templates.
- 30‚Äì90d: Engage 5 prospective partners; draft partner commercial terms (referral %, co‚Äësell splits).
- 90‚Äì180d: List target marketplaces (LMS), scope packaging requirements.

SECTION 2 ‚Äî Scalability Roadmap (grow from baseline to 10x revenue)
Structure: 3 phases over 36 months with measurable milestones.

Phase 0 ‚Äî Stabilise & Systematise (0‚Äì6 months) ‚Äî Target ARR: ¬£1‚Äì1.5M
- Goals: Harden delivery playbooks, improve conversion rates, increase average deal size.
- Milestones:
  - Standardised Sprint & workshop playbook completed and certified.
  - Sales playbook + value calculator live.
  - Pipeline of 20 qualified enterprise accounts.
- Revenue levers:
  - Improve briefing‚Üísprint conversion from 30% ‚Üí 45%.
  - Introduce a 3‚Äëmonth success package add‚Äëon at ¬£6‚Äì10k.

Phase 1 ‚Äî Scale Delivery & Demand (6‚Äì18 months) ‚Äî Target ARR: ¬£3‚Äì4M
- Goals: Grow headcount, launch productised digital offers, sign 3 strategic partners.
- Milestones:
  - Launch digital self‚Äëstudy course + certification (price per seat ¬£300‚Äì¬£800).
  - Train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer program launched; 5 partner trainers certified.
  - Increase monthly Complete Sprints to 6 / month.
- Revenue mix: 40% high‚Äëtouch sprints & workshops, 30% digital/licensing, 30% partner revenue.

Phase 2 ‚Äî Repeatable Scale & Leverage (18‚Äì36 months) ‚Äî Target ARR: ¬£6‚Äì12M
- Goals: Licensing model and platformisation, partner network at scale, automation reduces marginal delivery cost.
- Milestones:
  - Licensed offering to 15 partners; 4 market vertical specialists.
  - Rolling subscription product (LMS+playbooks) with 2000 seats sold/under license.
  - Monthly Complete Sprints 12+/month (mix of Brilliant Noise & partner delivery).
- Revenue mix: 30% direct consultancy, 50% product/licensing & digital, 20% partner income.

Specific actions & owners
- Sales Director: drive ABM and enterprise pipeline (owner).
- Head of Partnerships: recruit & enable partners (owner).
- Head of Product & Delivery: productise workshops, build LMS content.
- Quarterly KPI reviews: ARR, pipeline, conversion, CAC, gross margin.

SECTION 3 ‚Äî Operational Model (delivery process, quality control, resources)
Delivery process (end‚Äëto‚Äëend for Complete Sprint)
1. Discovery & Executive Briefing (pre‚Äësale prep)
   - Duration: 1‚Äì2 weeks
   - Deliverables: stakeholder map, current state AI adoption audit, success metrics.
2. Sprint planning & pre‚Äëwork
   - Duration: 2 weeks
   - Deliverables: customised curriculum, role‚Äëspecific pre‚Äëwork, data/access checklist.
3. Team Workshop 1 (capability & hands‚Äëon)
   - Duration: 1 day
   - Deliverables: role paths, initial playbooks, templates.
4. Team Workshop 2 (apply to real work)
   - Duration: 1 day (often a week later)
   - Deliverables: prototypes, automation recipes, saved time metrics.
5. Embed & Measure (30‚Äì90 days)
   - Duration: 30‚Äì90 days of success management
   - Deliverables: adoption dashboard, ROI tracking, internal champion enablement.

Resource requirements per Complete Sprint (typical)
- Programme Lead: 10 days
- 2 Senior Facilitators: 8 days each (prep + delivery)
- Learning Designer: 6 days (curriculum + materials)
- AI Engineer/Practitioner: 6 days (tools/templates, coaching)
- Customer Success / PM: 6 days
Total resource consumption ‚âà 44 consultant‚Äëdays (billable/effort) per sprint.

Capacity constraints (realistic)
- 1 FTE senior facilitator = ~12 billable days/month.
- With current team of 6, total ‚âà 72 billable days/month ‚Üí ~1‚Äì2 sprints + workshops as baseline.
- Growth trigger: when utilisation >80% and pipeline indicates +2 sprints/month, hire 1 Senior Facilitator + 0.5 AI Engineer.

Quality control & governance
- Standardised playbooks & templates (single source of truth in Notion or Confluence).
- Facilitator certification program (internal: bronze/silver/gold tiers).
- Pre‚Äëdelivery checklists & client sign‚Äëoff gates.
- Post‚Äëengagement NPS + outcome metrics (adoption %, hours saved per person).
- Quarterly peer review of deliverables and client feedback loop.

Action items (first 90 days)
- Codify delivery playbook + checklists; create 1‚Äëpage engagement KPI dashboard template.
- Build facilitator certification syllabus (owner: Head of Delivery).
- Set up delivery capacity spreadsheet and hire plan triggers.

SECTION 4 ‚Äî Partnership Framework (referral, co‚Äësell, strategic)
Partnership types & commercial models
1. Referral partners (agencies, consultants)
   - Fee: 10‚Äì20% of first year revenue or fixed referral fee (¬£2k‚Äì¬£5k per Complete Sprint referral).
   - Low admin, quick to scale.
2. Co‚Äësell partners (HR/L&D vendors, digital agencies)
   - Fee: 25‚Äì40% margin split on jointly delivered projects; Brilliant Noise handles methodology and QA.
   - Joint GTM events & shared pipeline ownership.
3. Reseller / White‚Äëlabel (large training providers)
   - Fee: wholesale pricing (40‚Äì60% discount) with support & certification requirements.
   - Good for geography scale & seat sales.
4. Technology & platform partners (OpenAI, LMS vendors, analytics)
   - Joint marketing, product integrations, credibility boost.
   - Non‚Äëfinancial (co‚Äëmarketing) + preferred supplier status.

Partner enablement
- Partner kit: pitch deck, 2 case studies, pricing matrix, co‚Äëdelivery playbook.
- 1‚Äëday partner certification bootcamp, quarterly enablement webinars.
- PRM (partner relationship management) portal + lead registration process.

Referral program mechanics (quick launch)
- Offer 15% commission on first‚Äëyear revenue for 12 months.
- Fast pay: pay within 30 days of client payment.
- Track via signed referral form & CRM tagging.
- Quarterly leaderboard + incentives.

Strategic partnerships (target list & outreach)
- HR/L&D integrators (global players with corporate client lists).
- Specialist agencies in CPG/retail (aligns with client list).
- Tech partners for enterprise AI governance & security.

Action items (0‚Äì90d)
- Build partner kit + one‚Äëpager commissions table.
- Hire/assign Head of Partnerships; sign 3 pilot partners in 6 months.
- Install PRM & define SLAs / quality gates for partner‚Äëdelivered engagements.

SECTION 5 ‚Äî Marketing Engine (channel priorities, content strategy, lead generation)
Priority channels & allocation
- Owned content & thought leadership (35% effort/cost) ‚Äî LinkedIn, long‚Äëform case studies, POVs.
- ABM & outbound (30%) ‚Äî targeted campaigns, executive briefings pipeline.
- Partner co‚Äëmarketing (15%) ‚Äî webinars, joint case studies.
- Paid LinkedIn / search for executive briefings (10%) ‚Äî tightly targeted.
- Events & PR (10%) ‚Äî speaking slots at CMO forums, B‚ÄëCorp community.

Content strategy (themes & assets)
- Executive assets (short, high‚Äëimpact):
  - Executive Briefing pack (90‚Äëminute) ‚Äî downloadable.
  - ROI calculator: show 20 hrs/month per person ‚Üí cost savings model.
  - 3 vertical case studies (adidas, BMW style) with before/after metrics.
- Mid‚Äëfunnel assets:
  - Workshop outcomes playbook (role‚Äëspecific recipes).
  - Short demo video of team outcomes & testimonials.
- Bottom‚Äëfunnel assets:
  - Implementation checklist, SLAs, pilot offer page.
- Evergreen: Blog series on "AI for Marketing Teams" ‚Äî 1 long piece/month.

Lead‚Äëgen plays (repeatable)
1. Executive Briefing funnel (signature)
   - Ads + LinkedIn outreach ‚Üí booking page ‚Üí paid briefing (¬£2k) ‚Üí upsell to workshop/sprint.
   - Conversion focus: briefing ‚Üí Sprint uplift via tailored ROI case.
2. Webinars & roundtables (monthly)
   - Invite top 40 ICP prospects per session; convert 15% to briefing.
3. ABM cadences
   - Multi‚Äëtouch: LinkedIn + email + phone + content + event invite.
   - Personalised email + ROI one‚Äëpager ‚Üí offer 90‚Äëmin paid briefing.
4. Partner co‚Äëhosted webinars ‚Äî pipeline share.

Metrics to track weekly/monthly
- SQLs, MQL‚ÜíSQL conversion, briefing bookings, briefing‚Üísprint conversion, CAC per channel, LTV, churn (for any subscription products).
- KPI targets (first 12 months): 30 booked briefings/month; 20% briefing‚ÜíComplete Sprint; pipeline to revenue conversion 10%.

Action items (30/60/120 days)
- Build landing pages for briefing, workshop, sprint with clear outcomes and booking flow.
- Launch ROI calculator and integrate into sales process.
- Produce 3 case studies and 6 LinkedIn thought posts for next 90 days.
- Run first ABM campaign to top 150 ICP accounts.

SECTION 6 ‚Äî Sales Process (qualification, conversion, onboarding)
Sales motion: Consultancy‚Äëled, outcomes‚Äëfocused.

Qualification framework (modified BANT)
- Budget: Is there training / transformation budget? (HR / L&D often a fund source)
- Authority: CMO / CDO / Head of Innovation engaged? Executive sponsor identified?
- Need: Adoption stalled? KPI tied to productivity or revenue?
- Timing: Are they looking to act in 30/60/90 days?
- Impact: Estimated people affected (# seats) √ó expected hours saved ‚Üí clear ¬£ impact.

Sales stages & activity
1. Engage (inbound briefing / outbound intro)
   - Asset: executive briefing offer.
   - KPI: booking rate.
2. Discover (scoped discovery call + pre‚Äëwork)
   - Deliverable: scope doc + success metrics.
3. Pilot / Sprint Proposal
   - Deliverable: proposal, timeline & outcomes, signed MSA.
4. Deliver (Sprint)
   - Internal alignment: delivery kickoff w/ client.
5. Expand (embed & upsell)
   - Success metrics review & cross‚Äësell packages (train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer, licensing).

Conversion levers
- Offer paid briefing at ¬£2k to pre‚Äëqualify seriousness and reduce time waste.
- Always include a success metric (e.g., expected hours saved & financial estimate).
- Time‚Äëlimited starter package discount to accelerate decision (e.g., 10% off Complete Sprint if signed within 30 days of briefing).

Onboarding checklist (first 30 days)
- Stakeholder kickoff & RACI.
- Access to platforms & sample tasks.
- Pre‚Äëwork assigned and baseline adoption metrics collected.
- Internal champion and measurement owner designated.

KPIs & targets
- Target briefing ‚Üí sprint conversion: 30‚Äì45% (ramp to 50% with refined ICP & messaging).
- Sales cycle time: target 8‚Äì10 weeks from initial conversation to signed sprint.
- Average deal size improvement levers: add subscription usage, success management retainer.

SECTION 7 ‚Äî Growth Levers (automation, productization, team expansion plan)
Automation opportunities (reduce marginal cost, increase throughput)
- Booking & payments: self‚Äëserve booking for executive briefings + automated upsell flow.
- Pre‚Äëwork & assessments: automated self‚Äëassessment tool that produces client readiness report.
- LMS + templated content: push standard role paths into an LMS to reduce facilitator prep time by 30‚Äì50%.
- AI assistant for scaled coaching: use prompt templates & a lightweight bot to support participants between workshops.
- Reporting automation: automatic adoption dashboards (data connectors to Slack, MS365, Google Workspace) to measure usage and hours saved.

Productization path (3 product tiers)
1. Productised Starter (Self‚Äëservice + light facilitation)
   - Digital course + templates + 2 live Q&A sessions. Price: ¬£500‚Äì¬£1,000 per seat.
   - Low touch, scalable revenue.
2. Core Offer (Current Complete Sprint)
   - High touch, bespoke. Price: ¬£17.5k+.
3. Enterprise Subscription (LMS + coaching + governance)
   - Annual contract: seat licences + quarterly strategy reviews + dedicated success manager.
   - Price: ¬£50‚Äì250k/year per large client (depending on seats & services).

Train‚Äëthe‚ÄëTrainer and Partner Certification
- Create a 3‚Äëday certification + enablement pack for partners / internal champions.
- Certification fuels reseller & white‚Äëlabel distribution.

Team expansion plan (hiring triggers & roles)
Baseline hires to reach Phase 1 (6‚Äì18 months)
- +2 Senior Facilitators (hire when pipeline indicates +2 sprints/month).
- +1 AI Engineer / Practitioner (for scaling toolkits and automation).
- +1 Customer Success Manager (for embed & subscriptions).
- +1 Head of Partnerships (if not already allocated).
- +1 Sales Director / Enterprise AE (to run ABM).

Phase 2 hires (18‚Äì36 months)
- +2 Learning Designers (digital course scale).
- +2 Partner Enablement / Ops.
- +1 Product Manager (for LMS & subscription).
- +1 Marketing Manager (demand gen)
- Consider regional leads for US/EU expansion.

Hiring triggers (quantitative)
- Hire Senior Facilitator when projected monthly Complete Sprints > current capacity + 2 for more than 2 months.
- Hire Customer Success when >6 active sprints in embed phase or first subscription customers signed.
- Hire Head of Partnerships if projected partner pipeline > 10 signed referrals / month.

Financial/Unit economics guardrails
- Target gross margin for high‚Äëtouch delivery: 50‚Äì60% (billable day rates vs salaries).
- Target gross margin for digital/licensed products: 70‚Äì90%.
- CAC payback target: <12 months for enterprise deals, <6 months for subscriptions.

SECTION 8 ‚Äî Growth Milestones, KPIs & Timeline (implementation calendar)
0‚Äì3 months
- Deliverables: delivery playbook, facilitator certification, partner kit, ABM list.
- Targets: 10 briefings booked/month, 2 new pilot partners contacted.
- Owners: Head of Delivery, Sales Director, Head of Partnerships.

3‚Äì9 months
- Deliverables: live digital course MVP, first 3 case studies, PRM deployed.
- Targets: Monthly briefings 20, Complete Sprints/month to 4‚Äì6, 3 partner certifications, revenue ¬£1.5‚Äì2.5M.
- Owners: Product & Delivery, Marketing.

9‚Äì18 months
- Deliverables: train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer launched, LMS packaged, first enterprise subscriptions signed.
- Targets: ARR ¬£3‚Äì4M, partner channel contributes 20% revenue, monthly sprints 6‚Äì8.
- Owners: Head of Partnerships, Sales Director.

18‚Äì36 months
- Deliverables: partner network 15+, licensed product revenue scale, automation stack largely in place.
- Targets: ARR ¬£6‚Äì12M, digital/licensing 40‚Äì60% revenue.
- Owners: CEO, Head of Product.

Specific 30/60/90 day action checklist (execution sprint)
- Day 0‚Äì30:
  - Finalise playbook + deliverable templates (Owner: Head of Delivery).
  - Build ABM target list & outreach sequences (Owner: Sales Director).
  - Create partner kit & outreach to 10 target partners (Owner: Head of Partnerships).
- Day 30‚Äì60:
  - Launch first ABM campaign; measure briefing bookings (Owner: Marketing & Sales).
  - Build digital course MVP (Owner: Learning Designer).
  - Run facilitator certification (Owner: Head of Delivery).
- Day 60‚Äì90:
  - Close first 3 paid briefings ‚Üí convert at least 1 to sprint.
  - Deploy referral program and pay first referral.
  - Implement automated reporting dashboard for client outcomes.

Risks & Mitigations
- Risk: quality dilution at scale ‚Üí Mitigation: strict certification, partner SLAs, internal QA.
- Risk: commoditisation by larger consultancies ‚Üí Mitigation: maintain boutique positioning, speed & practical ROI; leverage B‚ÄëCorp story.
- Risk: long enterprise sales cycles ‚Üí Mitigation: paid briefings to accelerate qualification & revenue; strong ABM pipeline.

Final notes ‚Äî what to measure weekly
- Sales: briefing bookings, pipeline value, Deals signed, average TtC (time to close).
- Delivery: utilisation %, active engagements, facilitator backlog.
- Marketing: MQLs, CAC by channel, briefing acquisition cost.
- Product: seats sold, certified partners, monthly recurring revenue (for subscriptions).

If helpful I can:
- Convert this playbook into a 90‚Äëday execution plan with owners and a Kanban view.
- Produce standard operating templates: playbook PDF, facilitator certification checklist, partner agreement draft, or the ROI calculator spreadsheet referenced above. Which would you like first?

- Events & PR (10%) ‚Äî speaking slots at CMO forums, B‚ÄëCorp community.

Content strategy (themes & assets)
- Executive assets (short, high‚Äëimpact):
  - Executive Briefing pack (90‚Äëminute) ‚Äî downloadable.
  - ROI calculator: show 20 hrs/month per person ‚Üí cost savings model.
  - 3 vertical case studies (adidas, BMW style) with before/after metrics.
- Mid‚Äëfunnel assets:
  - Workshop outcomes playbook (role‚Äëspecific recipes).
  - Short demo video of team outcomes & testimonials.
- Bottom‚Äëfunnel assets:
  - Implementation checklist, SLAs, pilot offer page.
- Evergreen: Blog series on "AI for Marketing Teams" ‚Äî 1 long piece/month.

Lead‚Äëgen plays (repeatable)
1. Executive Briefing funnel (signature)
   - Ads + LinkedIn outreach ‚Üí booking page ‚Üí paid briefing (¬£2k) ‚Üí upsell to workshop/sprint.
   - Conversion focus: briefing ‚Üí Sprint uplift via tailored ROI case.
2. Webinars & roundtables (monthly)
   - Invite top 40 ICP prospects per session; convert 15% to briefing.
3. ABM cadences
   - Multi‚Äëtouch: LinkedIn + email + phone + content + event invite.
   - Personalised email + ROI one‚Äëpager ‚Üí offer 90‚Äëmin paid briefing.
4. Partner co‚Äëhosted webinars ‚Äî pipeline share.

Metrics to track weekly/monthly
- SQLs, MQL‚ÜíSQL conversion, briefing bookings, briefing‚Üísprint conversion, CAC per channel, LTV, churn (for any subscription products).
- KPI targets (first 12 months): 30 booked briefings/month; 20% briefing‚ÜíComplete Sprint; pipeline to revenue conversion 10%.

Action items (30/60/120 days)
- Build landing pages for briefing, workshop, sprint with clear outcomes and booking flow.
- Launch ROI calculator and integrate into sales process.
- Produce 3 case studies and 6 LinkedIn thought posts for next 90 days.
- Run first ABM campaign to top 150 ICP accounts.

SECTION 6 ‚Äî Sales Process (qualification, conversion, onboarding)
Sales motion: Consultancy‚Äëled, outcomes‚Äëfocused.

Qualification framework (modified BANT)
- Budget: Is there training / transformation budget? (HR / L&D often a fund source)
- Authority: CMO / CDO / Head of Innovation engaged? Executive sponsor identified?
- Need: Adoption stalled? KPI tied to productivity or revenue?
- Timing: Are they looking to act in 30/60/90 days?
- Impact: Estimated people affected (# seats) √ó expected hours saved ‚Üí clear ¬£ impact.

Sales stages & activity
1. Engage (inbound briefing / outbound intro)
   - Asset: executive briefing offer.
   - KPI: booking rate.
2. Discover (scoped discovery call + pre‚Äëwork)
   - Deliverable: scope doc + success metrics.
3. Pilot / Sprint Proposal
   - Deliverable: proposal, timeline & outcomes, signed MSA.
4. Deliver (Sprint)
   - Internal alignment: delivery kickoff w/ client.
5. Expand (embed & upsell)
   - Success metrics review & cross‚Äësell packages (train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer, licensing).

Conversion levers
- Offer paid briefing at ¬£2k to pre‚Äëqualify seriousness and reduce time waste.
- Always include a success metric (e.g., expected hours saved & financial estimate).
- Time‚Äëlimited starter package discount to accelerate decision (e.g., 10% off Complete Sprint if signed within 30 days of briefing).

Onboarding checklist (first 30 days)
- Stakeholder kickoff & RACI.
- Access to platforms & sample tasks.
- Pre‚Äëwork assigned and baseline adoption metrics collected.
- Internal champion and measurement owner designated.

KPIs & targets
- Target briefing ‚Üí sprint conversion: 30‚Äì45% (ramp to 50% with refined ICP & messaging).
- Sales cycle time: target 8‚Äì10 weeks from initial conversation to signed sprint.
- Average deal size improvement levers: add subscription usage, success management retainer.

SECTION 7 ‚Äî Growth Levers (automation, productization, team expansion plan)
Automation opportunities (reduce marginal cost, increase throughput)
- Booking & payments: self‚Äëserve booking for executive briefings + automated upsell flow.
- Pre‚Äëwork & assessments: automated self‚Äëassessment tool that produces client readiness report.
- LMS + templated content: push standard role paths into an LMS to reduce facilitator prep time by 30‚Äì50%.
- AI assistant for scaled coaching: use prompt templates & a lightweight bot to support participants between workshops.
- Reporting automation: automatic adoption dashboards (data connectors to Slack, MS365, Google Workspace) to measure usage and hours saved.

Productization path (3 product tiers)
1. Productised Starter (Self‚Äëservice + light facilitation)
   - Digital course + templates + 2 live Q&A sessions. Price: ¬£500‚Äì¬£1,000 per seat.
   - Low touch, scalable revenue.
2. Core Offer (Current Complete Sprint)
   - High touch, bespoke. Price: ¬£17.5k+.
3. Enterprise Subscription (LMS + coaching + governance)
   - Annual contract: seat licences + quarterly strategy reviews + dedicated success manager.
   - Price: ¬£50‚Äì250k/year per large client (depending on seats & services).

Train‚Äëthe‚ÄëTrainer and Partner Certification
- Create a 3‚Äëday certification + enablement pack for partners / internal champions.
- Certification fuels reseller & white‚Äëlabel distribution.

Team expansion plan (hiring triggers & roles)
Baseline hires to reach Phase 1 (6‚Äì18 months)
- +2 Senior Facilitators (hire when pipeline indicates +2 sprints/month).
- +1 AI Engineer / Practitioner (for scaling toolkits and automation).
- +1 Customer Success Manager (for embed & subscriptions).
- +1 Head of Partnerships (if not already allocated).
- +1 Sales Director / Enterprise AE (to run ABM).

Phase 2 hires (18‚Äì36 months)
- +2 Learning Designers (digital course scale).
- +2 Partner Enablement / Ops.
- +1 Product Manager (for LMS & subscription).
- +1 Marketing Manager (demand gen)
- Consider regional leads for US/EU expansion.

Hiring triggers (quantitative)
- Hire Senior Facilitator when projected monthly Complete Sprints > current capacity + 2 for more than 2 months.
- Hire Customer Success when >6 active sprints in embed phase or first subscription customers signed.
- Hire Head of Partnerships if projected partner pipeline > 10 signed referrals / month.

Financial/Unit economics guardrails
- Target gross margin for high‚Äëtouch delivery: 50‚Äì60% (billable day rates vs salaries).
- Target gross margin for digital/licensed products: 70‚Äì90%.
- CAC payback target: <12 months for enterprise deals, <6 months for subscriptions.

SECTION 8 ‚Äî Growth Milestones, KPIs & Timeline (implementation calendar)
0‚Äì3 months
- Deliverables: delivery playbook, facilitator certification, partner kit, ABM list.
- Targets: 10 briefings booked/month, 2 new pilot partners contacted.
- Owners: Head of Delivery, Sales Director, Head of Partnerships.

3‚Äì9 months
- Deliverables: live digital course MVP, first 3 case studies, PRM deployed.
- Targets: Monthly briefings 20, Complete Sprints/month to 4‚Äì6, 3 partner certifications, revenue ¬£1.5‚Äì2.5M.
- Owners: Product & Delivery, Marketing.

9‚Äì18 months
- Deliverables: train‚Äëthe‚Äëtrainer launched, LMS packaged, first enterprise subscriptions signed.
- Targets: ARR ¬£3‚Äì4M, partner channel contributes 20% revenue, monthly sprints 6‚Äì8.
- Owners: Head of Partnerships, Sales Director.

18‚Äì36 months
- Deliverables: partner network 15+, licensed product revenue scale, automation stack largely in place.
- Targets: ARR ¬£6‚Äì12M, digital/licensing 40‚Äì60% revenue.
- Owners: CEO, Head of Product.

Specific 30/60/90 day action checklist (execution sprint)
- Day 0‚Äì30:
  - Finalise playbook + deliverable templates (Owner: Head of Delivery).
  - Build ABM target list & outreach sequences (Owner: Sales Director).
  - Create partner kit & outreach to 10 target partners (Owner: Head of Partnerships).
- Day 30‚Äì60:
  - Launch first ABM campaign; measure briefing bookings (Owner: Marketing & Sales).
  - Build digital course MVP (Owner: Learning Designer).
  - Run facilitator certification (Owner: Head of Delivery).
- Day 60‚Äì90:
  - Close first 3 paid briefings ‚Üí convert at least 1 to sprint.
  - Deploy referral program and pay first referral.
  - Implement automated reporting dashboard for client outcomes.

Risks & Mitigations
- Risk: quality dilution at scale ‚Üí Mitigation: strict certification, partner SLAs, internal QA.
- Risk: commoditisation by larger consultancies ‚Üí Mitigation: maintain boutique positioning, speed & practical ROI; leverage B‚ÄëCorp story.
- Risk: long enterprise sales cycles ‚Üí Mitigation: paid briefings to accelerate qualification & revenue; strong ABM pipeline.

Final notes ‚Äî what to measure weekly
- Sales: briefing bookings, pipeline value, Deals signed, average TtC (time to close).
- Delivery: utilisation %, active engagements, facilitator backlog.
- Marketing: MQLs, CAC by channel, briefing acquisition cost.
- Product: seats sold, certified partners, monthly recurring revenue (for subscriptions).

If helpful I can:
- Convert this playbook into a 90‚Äëday execution plan with owners and a Kanban view.
- Produce standard operating templates: playbook PDF, facilitator certification checklist, partner agreement draft, or the ROI calculator spreadsheet referenced above. Which would you like first?

sections.AI Innovation Programme ‚Ä¢ Executive Po:
## üéØ Problem
Large brands have fragmented R&D and vague AI roadmaps, so experiments are one-off, slow, and rarely translate into productised value or protectable IP. Without a repeatable process, promising AI work stalls for months and fails to deliver measurable commercial outcomes.

## üí° Solution
- We deploy a customised Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢ innovation process that converts R&D budgets into a quarterly pipeline of validated AI concepts, not ad‚Äëhoc pilots.  
- Run AI‚Äëpowered ideation workshops tailored to your industry and data, generating patent‚Äëworthy concepts ranked by commercial impact and technical feasibility.  
- Rapid prototype development (MVPs) within 30‚Äì90 days using cutting‚Äëedge models and our engineering patterns, reducing development cycle time by up to 4x.  
- Integrate validated prototypes into your existing R&D/product roadmap and hand over repeatable playbooks so internal teams can compound innovation capability each quarter.  
- Build internal capability through coached sprints and governance templates that protect IP, de‚Äërisk compliance, and embed measurable KPIs tied to business outcomes.

## ‚ú® Magic Moment
When a cross‚Äëfunctional sprint moves from whiteboard concept to a working prototype in a single quarter and the client signs off the roadmap to productise and patent it, the transformation becomes undeniable.

## Audience
- CMOs, CDOs, Innovation Directors and other C‚Äësuite leaders accountable for product or growth outcomes  
- Medium to large companies with dedicated R&D or innovation budgets ready to accelerate AI product development  
- Innovation‚Äëfocused organisations in tech, finance, CPG and other AI‚Äëready industries facing disruption pressure  
- R&D teams that need processes and playbooks to turn experiments into deployable IP

## Why We're Excited
As founders who have built digital transformation work since 2009, we believe the biggest commercial and ethical leverage lies at the intersection of strategy, creativity and applied AI. Brighton‚Äëbased and B‚ÄëCorp certified, we care about doing this responsibly and commercially: helping brands move from expensive, inconclusive pilots to a predictable cadence of market‚Äëready AI features that create measurable revenue or cost‚Äëavoidance. The AI Innovation Programme lets us scale the Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢ approach we‚Äôve proven with adidas, BMW and Nestl√© into repeatable outcomes‚Äîdelivering faster product cycles, stronger IP, and real capability inside client teams.

## Positioning Statement
Brilliant Noise‚Äôs AI Innovation Programme is a Brighton‚Äëbased B‚ÄëCorp boutique service that turns R&D budgets into predictable, patent‚Äëworthy AI product launches every quarter using Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢, rapid prototyping and capability transfer (from ¬£25k).

manifesto.fullContent:
# AI Innovation Programme ‚Ä¢ Executive Positioning

## üéØ Problem
Large brands have fragmented R&D and vague AI roadmaps, so experiments are one-off, slow, and rarely translate into productised value or protectable IP. Without a repeatable process, promising AI work stalls for months and fails to deliver measurable commercial outcomes.

## üí° Solution
- We deploy a customised Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢ innovation process that converts R&D budgets into a quarterly pipeline of validated AI concepts, not ad‚Äëhoc pilots.  
- Run AI‚Äëpowered ideation workshops tailored to your industry and data, generating patent‚Äëworthy concepts ranked by commercial impact and technical feasibility.  
- Rapid prototype development (MVPs) within 30‚Äì90 days using cutting‚Äëedge models and our engineering patterns, reducing development cycle time by up to 4x.  
- Integrate validated prototypes into your existing R&D/product roadmap and hand over repeatable playbooks so internal teams can compound innovation capability each quarter.  
- Build internal capability through coached sprints and governance templates that protect IP, de‚Äërisk compliance, and embed measurable KPIs tied to business outcomes.

## ‚ú® Magic Moment
When a cross‚Äëfunctional sprint moves from whiteboard concept to a working prototype in a single quarter and the client signs off the roadmap to productise and patent it, the transformation becomes undeniable.

## Audience
- CMOs, CDOs, Innovation Directors and other C‚Äësuite leaders accountable for product or growth outcomes  
- Medium to large companies with dedicated R&D or innovation budgets ready to accelerate AI product development  
- Innovation‚Äëfocused organisations in tech, finance, CPG and other AI‚Äëready industries facing disruption pressure  
- R&D teams that need processes and playbooks to turn experiments into deployable IP

## Why We're Excited
As founders who have built digital transformation work since 2009, we believe the biggest commercial and ethical leverage lies at the intersection of strategy, creativity and applied AI. Brighton‚Äëbased and B‚ÄëCorp certified, we care about doing this responsibly and commercially: helping brands move from expensive, inconclusive pilots to a predictable cadence of market‚Äëready AI features that create measurable revenue or cost‚Äëavoidance. The AI Innovation Programme lets us scale the Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢ approach we‚Äôve proven with adidas, BMW and Nestl√© into repeatable outcomes‚Äîdelivering faster product cycles, stronger IP, and real capability inside client teams.

## Positioning Statement
Brilliant Noise‚Äôs AI Innovation Programme is a Brighton‚Äëbased B‚ÄëCorp boutique service that turns R&D budgets into predictable, patent‚Äëworthy AI product launches every quarter using Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢, rapid prototyping and capability transfer (from ¬£25k).

sections.AI Innovation Programme ‚Ä¢ Product Capa:
Below is a concise, sales-ready summary of the core capabilities of Brilliant Noise‚Äôs AI Innovation Programme. Use this in decks, discovery calls and email outreach to explain what buyers will get ‚Äî and the business outcomes they can expect.

1) Primary Capabilities (3‚Äì5 with business benefit for each)
- Repeatable Innovation Process (Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢)
  - Business benefit: Converts ad‚Äëhoc experiments into a predictable quarterly pipeline of validated AI concepts so R&D budgets deliver measurable product and revenue outcomes rather than one‚Äëoff proofs.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe turn experimentation into a repeatable engine that produces productisable AI wins every quarter.‚Äù

- Rapid Prototyping & Validation
  - Business benefit: Build and validate prototype solutions in 6‚Äì12 weeks to de‚Äërisk investment, cut time‚Äëto‚Äëmarket by up to 4x and avoid costly dead‚Äëends.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúShip AI prototypes fast ‚Äî validate commercial value before you commit development budget.‚Äù

- AI‚Äëpowered Ideation & Opportunity Framing
  - Business benefit: Generate higher‚Äëvalue, patent‚Äëworthy concepts aligned to market and customer outcomes ‚Äî improving hit‚Äërate on investment and competitive differentiation.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe create breakthrough concepts that are commercially relevant and protectable.‚Äù

- Capability Building & Team Enablement
  - Business benefit: Embed practical skills, governance and playbooks in client teams so innovation compounds internally and reliance on external partners reduces over time.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt just deliver prototypes ‚Äî we upskill your teams to keep delivering them.‚Äù

- Commercialisation & IP Governance Support
  - Business benefit: Translate validated prototypes into product roadmaps, commercialization plans and IP strategies so promising work becomes revenue and defensible assets.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe help you move from prototype to product with clear go‚Äëto‚Äëmarket and IP plans.‚Äù

2) Delivery Method (how it works in practice)
- Kick-off & Alignment (Week 0‚Äì1)
  - Stakeholder alignment workshop to define business metrics, success criteria, constraints and decision rights.
  - Output: Prioritised opportunity brief and governance cadence.

- Ideation Sprint (1‚Äì2 weeks)
  - Facilitated AI‚Äëpowered workshops that rapidly surface concepts mapped to commercial KPIs and customer value.
  - Output: Ranked concepts and prototype briefs.

- Rapid Build & Validate (6‚Äì12 weeks per prototype)
  - Time‚Äëboxed sprints to build minimum viable prototypes, run controlled validation with users or simulations, and measure against predefined commercial metrics.
  - Output: Validated prototypes, go/no‚Äëgo recommendations and learnings.

- Commercialisation Planning (2‚Äì4 weeks)
  - Translate validated prototypes into roadmap, business case, go‚Äëto‚Äëmarket plan and IP strategy.
  - Output: Investment recommendation and implementation plan.

- Capability Transfer & Embedded Coaching (ongoing)
  - Train and coach client teams, create playbooks, and hand over repeatable processes so internal squads can run future cycles.
  - Cadence: Quarterly cycles with monthly governance reviews.

- Governance & Performance Tracking
  - Regular steering sessions and performance dashboards tied to business KPIs (revenue impact, time‚Äëto‚Äëmarket, cost savings, IP pipeline).

3) Integration Points (with existing tools/processes ‚Äî focus on business outcomes)
- R&D/Product Development
  - Outcome: Prototypes slot into existing roadmaps with clear investment cases and reduced downstream uncertainty.

- Portfolio & Roadmap Governance
  - Outcome: Adds a steady stream of prioritised, validated ideas into the product funnel for executive decisioning.

- Data & Analytics Teams
  - Outcome: Aligns experiments with existing data assets so validation uses real signals, accelerating commercial learning.

- Marketing & CRM
  - Outcome: Early prototypes can be tested with known customer segments and sales channels to prove adoption and inform GTM.

- Legal / IP / Compliance
  - Outcome: Early IP and compliance checks reduce risk and allow patentability and regulatory readiness to be baked into prototypes.

- Finance & Procurement
  - Outcome: Builds clear business cases and stage‚Äëgate budgets so finance can fund fast cycles with controlled spend.

- Cloud & Engineering Platforms
  - Outcome: Prototypes are designed to be portable to existing engineering stacks, reducing handover friction and time‚Äëto‚Äëproduction.

4) Capability Roadmap (current vs 6‚Äëmonth vision) ‚Äî business outcomes focus

Current (what we deliver now)
- Set up Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢ process and governance with client executives.
- Run ideation and 1‚Äì2 rapid prototypes (90 days) with validated commercial metrics.
- Deliver prototype handover, commercialization brief and playbook.
- Train a core internal squad (innovation owners + 2‚Äì4 practitioners).
- Early IP capture and go/no‚Äëgo recommendations.
- Business signals clients see: faster decisions on AI investment, one validated prototype in pipeline, initial uplift in R&D throughput.

6‚ÄëMonth Vision (what clients will have after two or three quarters)
- Operational quarterly pipeline delivering 3+ validated prototypes per quarter.
- 4x faster product development cycle for AI initiatives vs prior baseline.
- 1‚Äì2 patentable concepts filed or in development and clear commercialization paths for at least one.
- Internal ‚ÄúAI innovation squad‚Äù running cycles independently with Brilliant Noise coaching ‚Äî less reliance on external facilitation.
- Integrated governance with finance and product portfolio; stage‚Äëgate funding flows for rapid scale.
- Measurable business outcomes: clear revenue/efficiency impact per prototype, shorter time‚Äëto‚Äëmarket, higher R&D ROI.
- Business signals clients see: predictable pipeline of market‚Äëready AI features, stronger IP position, demonstrable revenue or cost savings from validated pilots.

Suggested KPI targets for sales conversations
- Time to validated prototype: 6‚Äì12 weeks
- Increase in R&D throughput: up to 4x
- Patents/priority IP concepts: 1‚Äì2 within 90 days for top ideas
- Quarterly validated concepts: 3+ once the programme is operational
- Typical starting investment: from ¬£25,000 (scales with ambition)

One‚Äëline close for CMOs / CDOs
- ‚ÄúWe take your R&D budget and convert it into a predictable, quarterly pipeline of validated, commercial AI innovations ‚Äî faster, lower risk, and with IP and go‚Äëto‚Äëmarket plans that move ideas into revenue.‚Äù

If you‚Äôd like, I can convert this into a one‚Äëpage sales sheet, a slide deck outline, or 30‚Äë and 90‚Äësecond pitch scripts tailored for CMOs vs CDOs. Which would help your team most?

# AI Innovation Programme ‚Ä¢ Product Capabilities

Below is a concise, sales-ready summary of the core capabilities of Brilliant Noise‚Äôs AI Innovation Programme. Use this in decks, discovery calls and email outreach to explain what buyers will get ‚Äî and the business outcomes they can expect.

1) Primary Capabilities (3‚Äì5 with business benefit for each)
- Repeatable Innovation Process (Test‚ÄëLearn‚ÄëLead‚Ñ¢)
  - Business benefit: Converts ad‚Äëhoc experiments into a predictable quarterly pipeline of validated AI concepts so R&D budgets deliver measurable product and revenue outcomes rather than one‚Äëoff proofs.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe turn experimentation into a repeatable engine that produces productisable AI wins every quarter.‚Äù

- Rapid Prototyping & Validation
  - Business benefit: Build and validate prototype solutions in 6‚Äì12 weeks to de‚Äërisk investment, cut time‚Äëto‚Äëmarket by up to 4x and avoid costly dead‚Äëends.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúShip AI prototypes fast ‚Äî validate commercial value before you commit development budget.‚Äù

- AI‚Äëpowered Ideation & Opportunity Framing
  - Business benefit: Generate higher‚Äëvalue, patent‚Äëworthy concepts aligned to market and customer outcomes ‚Äî improving hit‚Äërate on investment and competitive differentiation.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe create breakthrough concepts that are commercially relevant and protectable.‚Äù

- Capability Building & Team Enablement
  - Business benefit: Embed practical skills, governance and playbooks in client teams so innovation compounds internally and reliance on external partners reduces over time.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt just deliver prototypes ‚Äî we upskill your teams to keep delivering them.‚Äù

- Commercialisation & IP Governance Support
  - Business benefit: Translate validated prototypes into product roadmaps, commercialization plans and IP strategies so promising work becomes revenue and defensible assets.
  - Sales line: ‚ÄúWe help you move from prototype to product with clear go‚Äëto‚Äëmarket and IP plans.‚Äù

2) Delivery Method (how it works in practice)
- Kick-off & Alignment (Week 0‚Äì1)
  - Stakeholder alignment workshop to define business metrics, success criteria, constraints and decision rights.
  - Output: Prioritised opportunity brief and governance cadence.

- Ideation Sprint (1‚Äì2 weeks)
  - Facilitated AI‚Äëpowered workshops that rapidly surface concepts mapped to commercial KPIs and customer value.
  - Output: Ranked concepts and prototype briefs.

- Rapid Build & Validate (6‚Äì12 weeks per prototype)
  - Time‚Äëboxed sprints to build minimum viable prototypes, run controlled validation with users or simulations, and measure against predefined commercial metrics.
  - Output: Validated prototypes, go/no‚Äëgo recommendations and learnings.

- Commercialisation Planning (2‚Äì4 weeks)
  - Translate validated prototypes into roadmap, business case, go‚Äëto‚Äëmarket plan and IP strategy.
  - Output: Investment recommendation and implementation plan.

- Capability Transfer & Embedded Coaching (ongoing)
  - Train and coach client teams, create playbooks, and hand over repeatable processes so internal squads can run future cycles.
  - Cadence: Quarterly cycles with monthly governance reviews.

- Governance & Performance Tracking
  - Regular steering sessions and performance dashboards tied to business KPIs (revenue impact, time‚Äëto‚Äëmarket, cost savings, IP pipeline).

3) Integration Points (with existing tools/processes ‚Äî focus on business outcomes)
- R&D/Product Development
  - Outcome: Prototypes slot into existing roadmaps with clear investment cases and reduced downstream uncertainty.

- Portfolio & Roadmap Governance
  - Outcome: Adds a steady stream of prioritised, validated ideas into the product funnel for executive decisioning.

- Data & Analytics Teams
  - Outcome: Aligns experiments with existing data assets so validation uses real signals, accelerating commercial learning.

- Marketing & CRM
  - Outcome: Early prototypes can be tested with known customer segments and sales channels to prove adoption and inform GTM.

- Legal / IP / Compliance
  - Outcome: Early IP and compliance checks reduce risk and allow patentability and regulatory readiness to be baked into prototypes.

- Finance & Procurement
  - Outcome: Builds clear business cases and stage‚Äëgate budgets so finance can fund fast cycles with controlled spend.

- Cloud & Engineering Platforms
  - Outcome: Prototypes are designed to be portable to existing engineering stacks, reducing handover friction and time‚Äëto‚Äëproduction.

6‚ÄëMonth Vision (what clients will have after two or three quarters)

- 4x faster product development cycle for AI initiatives vs prior baseline.
- 1‚Äì2 patentable concepts filed or in development and clear commercialization paths for at least one.
- Internal ‚ÄúAI innovation squad‚Äù running cycles independently with Brilliant Noise coaching ‚Äî less reliance on external facilitation.
- Integrated governance with finance and product portfolio; stage‚Äëgate funding flows for rapid scale.
- Measurable business outcomes: clear revenue/efficiency impact per prototype, shorter time‚Äëto‚Äëmarket, higher R&D ROI.
- Business signals clients see: predictable pipeline of market‚Äëready AI features, stronger IP position, demonstrable revenue or cost savings from validated pilots.

Suggested KPI targets for sales conversations

- Increase in R&D throughput: up to 4x
- Patents/priority IP concepts: 1‚Äì2 within 90 days for top ideas
- Quarterly validated concepts: 3+ once the programme is operational
